attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all drivers and bikers to have an onboard camera
attributes.background: My husband was killed in May 2017 while he was doing 15mph on his motorbike. We have never had answers as to what happened that day. There we're 3 other vehicles involved and all statements were different. I feel if they had cameras we would have answers.

attributes.action: Increase Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) from 39 weeks to 52 weeks
attributes.background: It is important that new parents should not be put off taking their full entitlement to Maternity Leave for 52 weeks because they will not receive payment for the last 13 weeks of their leave. Currently SMP is only payable for the first 39 weeks of Maternity Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
The House of Commons Library contains a document entitled "Maternity pay and leave" dated 13 January 2010. It states that in December 2004 the Government announced a goal of extending maternity pay to twelve
months, from what was then 26 weeks (6 months). Although progress has been made and maternity pay is now paid for 39 weeks (9 months), I believe it is an important social issue to get that extra extension to 52 weeks (12 months).

attributes.action: Get the UK to ban all single use plastic items by 2030.
attributes.background:
Around 8 million tons of plastic enter the oceans each year, which is like emptying a garbage truck of plastic into an ocean every minute.

Governments MUST realize that the convenience of plastic is not worth the harm it causes

attributes.action: Change the official name & branding of the House of Lords to the House of Peers
attributes.background:
While over 25% of the members of the House of Lords are women, the name erases their existence, ignores their achievements and puts a gendered restriction in the heart of our nation's Parliament.

By changing the official name to the House of Peers, along with all branding, we can fix this mistake
attributes.additional_details: Today is International Women's Day 2018, sixty years since women were first allowed to sit as peers. If we could change our Parliament's name by IWD 2019 to include the 209 female peers who help make our country's laws, that would be a wonderful celebration of 60 years of women in British democracy.

attributes.action: Make a guarantee for no physical checks at NI side of border nor between GB & NI
attributes.background: The departure from the EU Customs Union means bilateral customs checks between ROI and UK, UK has promised unilaterally no physical border checks from its side between NI and ROI and NI and GB, this promise should be made into a legal guarantee as part of the so called "Great Repeal Bill".
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/uk-northern-ireland-border-brexit-eu-hard-no-deal-cabinet-irish-a8235096.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/irish-hard-border-soft-brexit-technology-theresa-may-a8242461.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-43277181

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/02/09/uk-must-set-stone-commitment-no-hard-irish-border-brexit-talks/

https://news.sky.com/story/government-wants-no-changes-to-irish-border-arrangements-10991079

attributes.action: Guarantee divorced/separated parents a minimum level of access to their children
attributes.background: Without a court order a divorced/ seperated parent has no automatic right to see their children. Iâ€™d like there to be a set minimum level of access granted to parents without the need for court orders that may take a long time to approve and are very costly to obtain.

attributes.action: Add the discrimination against people with tattoos to The Equality Act
attributes.background: Currently the discrimination against people with tattoos in and out the work place is evident within the UK, we need to ensure people with tattoos are safe guarded against discrimination

attributes.action: Government to pay for all car repairs caused by potholes
attributes.background: We all pay car tax and council tax and yet our roads are left in unsafe and damaged conditions many of witch need ripping up and relaying completely which can cause serious damage to our cars. Having paid the tax, we should not have to pay for any damage to wheels, suspension, track rods, cv joints.
attributes.additional_details: These roads are being reported yet only a temporary fix or not at all until such time the roads are safe to drive on with out the risk of damage the local council or government should pick up the bills.

attributes.action: Leave the MOT tests for all vehicles the same and remove future changes.
attributes.background: Iâ€™m writing this petition to raise the thoughts on the up coming changes for the MOT tests towards vehicles. This is to raise the thoughts of others that donâ€™t believe the changes are fair and that these changes are going to have a large effect on vehicles and history.

attributes.action: Give employment rights to contracted employees with less than 2 years service.
attributes.background:
If unfairly dismissed from a position when you have been with a company for less than 2 years, presently you can do nothing about it. 
If you have worked for 2 years or more, you can file for unfair dismissal.
attributes.additional_details:
Example: Jenifer was promoted after 12 months working, but after 4 months in the new position, Jenifer was dismissed. The reason given was that she was not picking the new job up as quickly as the employer thought she should be. 
No further training was offered, or the option to go back to her previous role. This was unfair dismissal, however she had only worked for the company for 18 months. ACAS are not able to assist in this case, which the company knew when dismissing her. Action is needed!

attributes.action: Ban private parking firms from operating within the NHS.
attributes.background: I recently had to spend a lot of time visiting my ill mother in hospital. It opened my eyes to the fact so many people have huge worries regarding parking to see to their loved ones as the cost is so high. The worst bit about it is not a penny was going back into the hospital but to a private firm.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website states:
Charges should be reasonable for the area.
Concessions, including free or reduced charges or caps, should be available for the following groups:
Disabled people
Frequent outpatient attenders
Visitors with relatives who are gravely ill, or carers of such people
Visitors to relatives who have an extended stay in hospital, or carers of such people
Carers of people in the above groups where appropriate.
My recent visits of Â£18 per day is certainly not within these guidelines.

attributes.action: Condemn the Israeli government killing innocent civilians and unarmed protesters
attributes.background: Condemn the Israeli government for killing innocent people like the 21 year old nurse who was shot dead on 1/06/18 by Israeli soldiers while treating injured Palestinian protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
The death of this nurse cannot go un noticed. This killing must stop and there is more the British government can do to ease matters into peace.  

Targeting medics let alone unarmed protesters is a war crime under the ***Geneva Convention***.

attributes.action: Revise firearms certificates to allow for wider gun access but harder to obtain
attributes.background: We want to see revisions to Section 1 firearms certificates so that law abiding, mentally healthy citizens have the privilege and freedom to own a wider range of weaponry for the purposes of sports and protection of private property.
attributes.additional_details:
The revisions I am proposing are:
Allow for the sale of semi-automatic, centre-fire rifles to citizens with a section 1 firearms certificate
Allow for the sale of pistols to citizens with a section 1 firearms certificate
Allow for the protection of private property to be a reason for owning a firearm
Reduce the length of firearm certificate to be reduce from 5 to 1 year so mental health and criminal checks happen more often
Change the price of a certificate to make renewal easy but entry hard

attributes.action: Fund baby hatches to allow newborns to be left safely and anonymously
attributes.background:
There have been several cases of newborn babies being abandoned. Most recently and sadly was the case of baby Pearl in Rochdale, Manchester who was found dead in the woods. 
Many countries have baby hatches to allow babies to be abandoned safely, where they can receive immediate attention.
attributes.additional_details:
Belgium, Germany and Canada have introduced baby hatches where a parent can abandon their newborn baby anonymously. This means that despite this desperate act, the infant is safe and warm and an alert is generated so that someone arrives to care for the child straight away. 
This is scheme is needed in the UK to ensure that these parents have a safe space to leave their child and do not have to resort to leaving the infant at risk.

attributes.action: Only allow students to register to vote in one constituency
attributes.background: In the 2017 general election students registered to vote in their town and university town. I would like them to only be able to register to vote in one constituency in general elections.

attributes.action: Prohibit the act of infant male circumcision without a proper medical reasoning.
attributes.background: Male circumcision in infants is an unnecessary, irreversible and unfair procedure to place upon a boy who may in the future disagree with the reasons for which it was done. Religion and parental opinion are not appropriate reasons to remove a part of a boys body when they lack the ability to refuse.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition goes against strapping a infant boy to a table and cutting away at his genitals without medical reasoning. It does not go against voluntary circumcision by a consenting person.
Issue's like Phimosis, are an appropriate reason to conduct such a procedure as the condition is uncomfortable and fixable. It is known the procedure has no link to higher chances of STD's or HIV in the western world. Promoting safe sex is an alternative to preemptive surgery that is in turn irreversible.

attributes.action: the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards" to British citizens
attributes.background: Many British citizens, while staying in other European countries, risk being fined for failing to carry a national identity card or passport, because the British passport is insufficiently small or durable to carry at all times. Therefore the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards".

attributes.action:
Mandatory signs on all disabled facilities -
"Not all disabilities are visible"
attributes.background: Since developing a chronic urinary disease, I have found myself needing to use disabled facilities often. However, due to not bearing any obvious or visible disability and only a hidden one, I have faced criticism and been confronted on many occasions as to why I am using such facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and thousands of other people who suffer from unseen disabilities are having to defend ourselves and on many occasions show proof as to why they need to use disabled facilities. 
When I am in need to use the disabled loos, I have often been confronted by others. This is discrimination.

I am petitioning for all disabled facilities in the UK to bear mandatory signs reading "Not all disabilities are visible". 
This is to aim to put a stop to such discrimination and prejudice.

attributes.action: Make it legal for motorcyclists to ride without a helmet on
attributes.background: In the UK it has been illegal for most to ride with a helmet on. This does not apply to certain religious groups. I think that bikers from all walks of life should get the choice if they use a helmet or not.
attributes.additional_details: When Motor Cycles (Wearing of Helmets) Regulations 1973 (S.I., 1973, No. 180) was passed, it became illegal in the UK for anyone to ride without a helmet on. This was amended by the Crash-Helmets (Religious Exemption) Act, 1976, to give some groups the ability to opt out of using them. I don't debate that they have saved lives, but a study done in the US stated that it was only a 37% decrease. Furthermore it is primarily the biker that will face the consequences, so why force them into using one.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for drivers to hit and run when hitting a domestic animal
attributes.background: This point needs to be put into action because domesticated animals being killed with no justice is no option and should be a criminal offence. When an animal companion is removed it leaves people feeling very alone and broken, looking for justice that currently canâ€™t be served - personal experience

attributes.action: Ban schools from supplying milk cartons with plastic straws.
attributes.background: Eco teams from two primary schools in the North West are collaborating to ban plastic straws from school milk after learning about the damage they are causing to our wildlife and habitats.
attributes.additional_details: The children estimate that 1.7 million children have milk each day in Key Stage 1, so approximately 8.5 million straws are discarded each week.  The Government must ban schools from giving children milk with plastic straws, ban local authorities from buying milk with plastic straws, and ensure that all milk supplied to schools meets minimum Eco standards so that no unnecessary plastic, like straws, are used in manufacturing or packaging.

attributes.action: A commemorative plaque for the contributions made by the Windrush Generation.
attributes.background: As a result of the recent  negative treatment of the Windrush Generation,   we should instead  acknowledge their invaluable contributions to the successes of British life over the years.

attributes.action: Include cycle paths in post-Brexit farming subsidies
attributes.background: Rewarding farmers for providing cycle paths across farmland, would offer safe routes to schools and work, connecting villages and towns. This would reduce pollution, provide leisure opportunities, compensate for lost bus services and contribute to the well being of the nation.

attributes.action: Go back to the old GCSEs and abolish the new 9-1 Grading system
attributes.background: The new GCSEs are incredibly difficult and it results in many students failing or getting low grades. The new system has set students for failure and has even increased the difficulty to that of the old A-levels. This is inconsiderate and unjust. We must abolish this system.

attributes.action: A petition to action Government to posthumously pardon all Suffragettes
attributes.background: From 1900 to the beginning of WW1 approximately 1,000 women were imprisoned in the British campaign to gain the votes for women.These women suffered and sacrificed a lifetime for generations today to live an equal life.These women should be posthumously pardoned and celebrated for their bravery.
attributes.additional_details: As a relative of Emmeline Pankhurst there has never been a more appropriate time to pursue the notion of having suffragettes that were imprisoned during the Votes for Women campaign posthumously pardoned and their efforts celebrated. Despite the peaceful efforts of Millicent Fawcett, Emmeline and her daughters at the start of the campaign, progress was slow and their voices dampened. Many courageous women pushed the campaign forward in a way that ensured their voices were heard 'Votes for Women'

attributes.action: Invest more money in youth charities and youth service providers in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a profound reduction in services for young people resulting from funding cuts. With huge pressures on all local authority budgets, these cuts wonâ€™t be reversed. We have to support the organisations who help young people from areas with high levels of deprivation and low income backgrounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2012, in London alone at least Â£22 million has been cut from council youth service budgets and 12,700 places for young people have been lost. The average council has cut its youth service budget by nearly Â£1 million, an average of 36%. (London's Lost Youth Services, 2017).

Across the country more than 1 in 10 think their life will amount to nothing, no matter how hard they try. 42% of young people feel traditional goals like getting a steady job are unrealistic (Prince's Trust, 2017).

attributes.action: Restore Nursing bursaries
attributes.background:
The shortage of nursing staff is adversely affecting patient care 
Scrapping nursing bursaries has affected the recruitment of nurses
Nursing is one of the most valuable professions , and should be supported in every way possible

attributes.action: Establish a support body to advise and protect Beneficiaries of Wills and Trusts
attributes.background: Support body to provide free help and advice to beneficiaries:  To ensure proper estate administration.  Advising on; confusing Will language, dwindling estate concerns, uncertainty of legal rights, high executor fee charges, lack of transparency or information, unresponsive administrators etc.
attributes.additional_details:
This support body (funded by increase in Probate tax) to:-

â€¢Provide legal advice to beneficiaries in clear and simple terms   
â€¢Ensure executor accountability 
â€¢Have powers to take action against executors to protect beneficiaries where there are failings in responsibilities and duty of care.

We ask for Parliament to change the law, ensuring that executors are legally bound to clearly inform beneficiaries of the existence of this body and provide its contact details with Will delivery.

attributes.action: Make AED Defibrillators available more publicly (at least every second street).
attributes.background: AED Defibrillators are a crucial part of basic first aid. Cardiac arrest involves a person being on the verge of dying. Cardiopulmonary Resusictation (CPR) is effective but AED defibrillators may double the chance of a person surviving. This could potentially save your or a loved one life.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Heart Foundation, 100,000 people die from sudden cardiac arrest each year. Without treatment, 95% of the time a cardiac arrest results in death. Having a defibrillator in close proximity is vital, as 80% of cardiac arrests occur at home, with every minute of it being untreated the chance of survival falls by 9%. Having a defibrillator in every street or two, and making neighbors aware of it saves valuable time in treatment and thousands of lives!
Sign up to Save!

attributes.action: Stop assessing higher education students on their parental income!
attributes.background: As a student In a living in a city, being able to survive on student finance is challenging. Like most students the money I have to survive on is assessed by parental income, not taking into account mortgages and other bills to pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Many students I've spoken to are in a similar situation, Their parents would love to help them out with an additional Â£3-Â£4k per year but financially aren't in this position. Thus meaning they are unable to support us as student finance believes they should/could.

Due to the lack of student finance for our future workforce, we are forced into overdrafts before leaving education.

attributes.action: Utility companies to be responsible for repairing potholes around poor repairs
attributes.background: A majority of potholes form around places of existing weakness, such as road repair works following companies digging up the roads for routine maintenance.  These companies should be responsible for filling any potholes that are a consequence of a road weakness following their actions
attributes.additional_details:
Potholes are caused when water penetrates cracks in the road. When this water freezes, it expands, widening the cracks. When it melts, traffic smashes new craters into the road surface.  Other countries do not have many drains and services under their roads, and do not give privatised utility companies the right to dig up a new road
An increasing number of road users are taking legal action. The AA estimates that the cost to insurers of claims (pothole damage) was Â£2.85m during February alone.

attributes.action: UK govt to build a ship which can remove and recycle plastic from the oceans
attributes.background:
There are "islands" of plastic in our oceans which are 1- dangerous to marine life;  2- polluting our world; 3- a waste of resources
4- a human problem.
The UK govt could lead the world by building a ship which can collect the plastic, process it and bring to the UK to reuse the plastic
attributes.additional_details:
Ecological - There are millions of tons of resources lying on the ocean, we put it there, we should retrieve it. 

Resource - The technology exists to collect and re-use that plastic resource (think of it like a natural resource which we can mine and exploit). We can build infrastructure projects with free plastic!

Britain was built on a sea-faring heritage. Post-Brexit, this is an opportunity to show that we still lead the world. 

Finally, why would you or any country say "no"?

attributes.action: Make Battle of Britain Day, the 15th of September, a public holiday.
attributes.background: Let the 15th of September as "Battle of Britain Day" be made a public holiday to celebrate that one day in the field of human conflict that represents that grand singularity of the unity of purpose of the diverse peoples of this great nation that says 'together we are'.
attributes.additional_details:
The Battle of Britain, as fought between the 10th of July and the 31st of October, 1940, was summed up by Winston Churchill with the words "Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few". 

On the 15th of September, 1940, the Luftwaffe embarked on its largest bombing attack yet, which required the engagement of the entirety of the RAF in defence of London and the South East, resulting in a decisive British victory that marked the turning point in Britain's favour.

attributes.action: Make typing and full keyboard skills a compulsory part of secondary education.
attributes.background:
Children today are having to do much of their education online and on computers.  Yet they are not taught to type properly.  This leads to slow work and frustration.  
We do not give a child a pencil and expect them to learn to write. Yet we give them a keyboard and expect them to learn to type.

attributes.action: Action an effective NHS care pathway for patients with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is an inherited connective tissue abnormality.People with EDS have no care within the NHS. Healthcarer's have no access to formal training, forcing patients to self fund private care with the few specialists available, in order to manage their multiple,painful & life threatening disabilities.
attributes.additional_details:
EDS UK and the Royal College of GP's are working together to improve education on EDS and to create a 'toolkit' for GP's managing patients with the condition. (https://www.ehlers-danlos.org/news/spotlight/). 

At present, patients like myself are forced to fundraise for urgent and long term care to manage disabilities, extreme pain, dislocations, and at times life saving surgeries abroad. No specialist area has claimed the condition leaving GP's unaware of who to refer patients to for their care

attributes.action: Serious injuries caused by careless driving should lead to imprisonment.
attributes.background: People's lives are completely changed for the worst due to drivers lack of care on the road. Victims of this often result there pain in suicide, leaving a large strain on not only the victims' lives but the people around them.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers do not deserve to walk away freely from the pain they have caused.

attributes.action: Offer legal aid for all women/ men who have been a victim of domestic abuse
attributes.background: Legal aid is not currently available to all domestic abuse survivors. There are very specific conditions you must meet to be valid, which does not take into consideration any financial abuse or manipulation, which has left a lot of victims struggling to pay off debt and get divorced at the same time

attributes.action: Put pressure on the U.K. Government to condemn child sex trafficking in India.
attributes.background:
The Independent recently wrote an article about child sex trafficking in India and how big of an issue it is. The article highlighted just how big of a problem sex trafficking is in India. 
 
We urge the U.K Government to condemn this and urge the Indian government to take action.
attributes.additional_details: If you would like to read more on the issue here is a link attached: https://breakthechainscampaign.wordpress.com/2017/12/08/sexual-exploitation/

attributes.action: More funding for the NHS Blood Donation Service
attributes.background:
The NHS Blood donation service needs more direct funding. 

The service has cut services in the last few years, and regular blood donors are unable to find local sessions to make their donations, often waiting many months. This happens despite the regular appeals to for priority donors.
attributes.additional_details:
Regular donors, even priority donors, often have to wait for months to obtain an appointment to give blood.

The blood donation service has many reasons for an insecure blood supply stock: seasonal demand, lack of new donors, and relatively few donors from certain groups of the population. 

If the blood service continues to cut donor session availability, this could cause serious supply issues in certain vital blood stocks, such as O Negative, B Negative, and A Negative.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring NHS Trusts to release patient records within 21 days
attributes.background: Currently, there are significant variations between NHS trusts as to how long they will take to release patient records when requested. We, the undersigned, call on the government to standardise this in law to 21 days, as for many people accessing their medical records is potentially time critical

attributes.action: Ban the use of flammable cladding on all buildings
attributes.background: The Grenfell Tower disaster shows clearly that the use of flammable cladding should be banned on all buildings.

attributes.action: Recognise autism assistance dogs as an Assistance Service Dog like guide dogs.
attributes.background: Everywhere you go you see no dogs allowed except guide dogs. Obviously guide dogs help people see but for a child or adult who has additional needs or autism this helps them be more safe secure and make them more comfortable in surroundings they wouldnâ€™t usually be comfortable in.
attributes.additional_details:
They have little sense of danger. 1 in 100 children in the UK are diagnosed with Autism. Half of these children will have a tendency to bolt and wander off, which can be very dangerous, and has often resulted in injuries to the child. 

Autism Assistance Dogs are trained to provide safety and companionship, helping to bring independence and a more socially inclusive Promote positive changes in behaviour Provide comfort for children when upset Reduce behavioural outbursts.

attributes.action: Ensure money raised from new sugar levy is divided between education and the NHS
attributes.background:
The Government recently introduced the sugar levy on soft drinks to try and tackle the growing problem of obesity in the UK. The legislation doesnâ€™t specify where the money raised should be spent.
We would like legislation created to ensure that any money raised is given to the NHS and to education
attributes.additional_details: The levy on soft drinks is expected to raise over Â£274 million pounds which could be used to help fund the struggling NHS budget and also fund sport activities for school children.

attributes.action: Introduce a new system to ensure that roads are maintained to a safe standard.
attributes.background: Despite a legal requirement for roads to be maintained to a safe standard, highway authorities have been allowed to put lives at risk by letting many roads become unsafe. Urgent action is needed now to remedy this and a new system needed to prevent this from happening in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation and guidance on road maintenance lie with the Highways Act 1980 and the Well-Maintained Highways: Code of Practice, respectively. Both these require that roads should be maintained in a safe condition but this is clearly not happening. Individuals can go through the process of suing for damage or injury but this has proved inadequate in preventing roads being allowed to deteriorate into a dangerous state. There is a clear lack of accountability and an absence of desire on behalf of the government to implement the requirements of existing legislation and guidance. A new system is therefore required to ensure that safe standards are set and that these standards are met.

attributes.action: Halt arms sales to Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has carried out indiscriminate airstrikes in Yemen which have resulted in thousands of civilian deaths.
attributes.additional_details: These have been allowed by the British government's licensing of Â£4.6bn of arms sales to the kingdom since the start of the Yemeni Civil War in 2015. Saudi Arabia's blockade of Yemen has also resulted in the worst humanitarian crisis in the world.

attributes.action: Issue an official apology to Lauren Southern for denial of entry into the UK
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern was detained in Calais by Kent police and charged under section 7 of the terrorism act, before being denied entry into the UK.

The Government must apologise for this.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that that section 7 was wrongfully applied as Section 41 states that "A constable may arrest without a warrant a person whom he reasonably suspects to be a terrorist." I do not believe that the police believed Lauren Southern to be a terrorist.

attributes.action: Make It Mandatory for Employers to Educate Employees on "Employment Rights"
attributes.background:
Discrimination at work is a harsh reality of British Labour Market. This is mainly due to lack of training among the employers and lack of understanding of rights among the employees. 
The only way to protect ourselves and next generation is to make it mandatory for employers to educate their staff
attributes.additional_details:
Equality and Human Rights Commission on 21/12/2017 reported that ethnic minorities have a 12.9% higher unemployment rate.

Black workers with degrees earn 23.1% less on average.

In Britain, only 8.8% of the minorities worked at a manager level or higher.

Based on GOV statistics from Jan-Sep 2017:
13% of the jurisdictional complaints were related to Equal Pay
11.7% for discrimination of some kind.

These numbers are alarming!

So please sign the petition and protect our rights.EDUCATE EMPLOYEES

attributes.action: Include courses on the awareness of terminal illnesses in schools
attributes.background: Include courses in the PSHE curriculum to teach children about terminal illnesses in our schools, and how to deal with them.
attributes.additional_details: Many children do not know how to react to and deal with a family member, friend, or themselves being diagnosed with terminal illnesses such as cancer.

attributes.action: Stop the purchase of gas boilers and associated parts without a registration.
attributes.background: If the law stated, that selling and buying both domestic and commercial Gas, Oil and LPG boilers and associated parts, without governing body registrations became law, the dangerous practice of unqualified and dangerous installations would cease. Thus improving the safety for all and save lives.

attributes.action: Stop reducing child maintenance monies by allowing travel expenses to be claimed
attributes.background: Did you know that when child maintenance monies are awarded through the CMO (previously CSA) they allow the non resident parent to claim travel expenses (regardless of how far they wish to move away) against the child maintenance award thus lowering it further. Stop disadvantaging our children.
attributes.additional_details: Child maintenance is normally sought via the CMO as a last resort when other avenues have been explored for fairness for the child. The key focus for resident and non resident parent should be THE CHILD and providing financial and emotional stability as if you hadnâ€™t separated.  This claiming process looks to add conflict. Child maintenance was set up to aid THE CHILD. The non-resident could chose to move away 100â€™s of miles away yet the child would be monetarily disadvantaged as a result.
